conclusion: Analyze the motion of objects A and B before and after the string breaks.
Determine the acceleration of the system.
Object A is hanging vertically, and object B is on the inclined plane.
The forces acting on object A are gravity and tension in the string.
The forces acting on object B are gravity, normal force, and tension in the string.
Since the string is massless and friction is negligible, the tension is the same throughout the string.
For object A: T - mg = ma
For object B: mg sin θ - T = ma
Adding these equations: mg - mg sin θ = 2ma
a = g(1 - sin θ)/2
Given θ = 37°
Determine the time for object A to hit the ground.
Object A falls a distance h = 1 m with acceleration a = 2 m/s².
Using the kinematic equation: h = (1/2) a t²
t² = 1
t = 1 s
Analyze the motion after the string breaks.
Determine the velocity of object B at the moment the string breaks.
Object B has been accelerating for t = 1 s with acceleration a = 2 m/s².
Using the kinematic equation for velocity: v = at
Determine the time for object B to return to the bottom of the inclined plane.
